intro: Draba brackenridgei, commonly known as Brackenridge's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Draba brackenridgei is a perennial herb that produces yellow or white flowers, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Its small stature and ability to survive in harsh conditions make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
